data.title: Gumbrecht) The Powers of Philology
data.meta_description: Gumbrecht%5d the Powers of Philology  - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. This document is an introduction to a book about the powers of philology. It begins by discussing how the term "philologist" has been applied broadly to scholars like Ernst Robert Curtius, Leo Spitzer, and Erich Auerbach, even though they did not specialize in traditional philological practices of text editing and commentary. It then notes that the term "philology" can refer either broadly to the study of language and literature or more specifically to the historical study and curation of written texts. The introduction argues that philology should be understood in the narrower sense, involving the identification and restoration of past cultural texts through practices like identifying fragments, editing texts, and writing commentaries, supported by historicization and
